Content: Your best protection from COVID-19 will be a combination of getting a COVID-19 vaccine, wearing a mask, staying at least 6 feet away from others, avoiding crowds, and washing your hands often. No one tool alone is going to stop the pandemic.
One of the best gifts you can give to others is protecting them from COVID-19 by wearing a face mask. Read more in our face mask directive here:

Because you can't eat and wear a mask at the same time.

I‚Äôve said it often- we shouldn‚Äôt need a mandate to love one another, and ourselves. We should do it because it‚Äôs the right thing to do. 

Wearing masks ; watching distances/avoiding non household gatherings saves lives, helps health workers, and is good for the economy (ie you).

There are epidemic curves to both mitigated ; unmitigated surges, BUT the peak is higher ; the duration of the surge is 2X longer without mitigation. 
In other words, masks, distancing, and targeted closures early, mean earlier reopenings, more hospital capacity, and less deaths.

Tests for COVID-19 can involve swabs of the nose, mouth or throat. Swabs usually take no more than 15 seconds to complete and have been said to cause mild discomfort at most.

COVID-19 testing involves a cotton-tipped swab being gently passed through a nostril ; into the nasopharynx, located over the roof of the mouth. The swab is quickly rotated ; removed.
